Roeddwn i'n gweithio'n ymlaen, felly roeddwn i'n gwybod hynny hefyd.
A oes gennych chi'r gwaith o weithio yn y Mhob ymlaen, a'i helpu i chi gyda'r gweinidog?
Rwy'n credu, a'i gwneud ychydig o ddiddordeb hefyd.
Oherwydd, ym mhob, roeddwn i'n cael ymgyrch ym Mhob, a yna roeddwn i'n mynd i'r Gweinidog.
Why do you think you never went back to work in an office, in a factory,
since you say you enjoyed it?
Opportunities. Jobs got harder to get, and I just took whatever opportunity showed itself, you know.
They had children to juggle then, I had three children to juggle.
So, how do you feel about your time working in the factory?
I enjoyed it, I've got to be honest. I did enjoy it.
What did it give you, do you think?
Experience, confidence, the ability to learn different jobs, and socialising.
I just enjoyed the job and that was it.
So, you got married when you were still at Louie Edwards.
Yes.
Did they give you a present or anything?
Oh yes, yes. They had a tremendous collection, they must have, because they bought me everything possible in Pyrex.
Tea service, dinner service, casseroles, dishes, fruit set, and it was all in the same.
I had boxes and boxes, one of the boys had to take me home in his car, because we didn't have a car then, did we?
I think it was the supervisor from the captain's room, Les, he took me home.
I had about four or five boxes all full of this Pyrex. Absolutely wonderful it was.
Was that something they did for everybody, do you know?
Well, as far as I know, I couldn't get over it. It was a tremendous wedding present.
That was very generous.
Very generous, yes.
Have you still got some of it?
I've still got some of it, yes. Not a lot of it, but there's still some of it there.
That's great. Thank you very much.
